'Malonic acid' (IUPAC systematic name: 'propanedioic acid') is a dicarboxylic
acid with structure CH 2(COOH) 2. The ionized form of
malonic acid, as well as its esters and salts, are known as '[[malonate]]s'. For
example, diethyl malonate is malonic acid's diethyl ester. The name originates
from the Greek word Î¼á¾¶Î»Î¿Î½ (malon) meaning 'apple'.
